title: A pickup’s persistent plastic pan problems
author: John Paul
bullets: Ford F-150 2018 model owner faces repeated plastic oil pan leaks; considering replacing with metal pan.
Ford covers plastic oil pan replacements under warranty but not custom metal pan parts.
Replacing the oil pan with a metal one requires 10 hours labor; plastic pan replacement takes five hours.

title: Patriots get bad news with injuries ahead of Bucs matchup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kayshon Boutte, Rhamondre Stevenson, and Garrett Bradbury missed Wednesday's practice due to injuries.
Patriots may rely on rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams against the Bucs if Boutte and Stevenson are unavailable.
Linebacker Christian Elliss was also sidelined with a hip injury, adding to the Patriots' injury woes.

title: Boston youth baseball coach pleads not guilty to drug trafficking charge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Bryan Mejia, 31, a youth baseball coach, pleaded not guilty to a felony fentanyl trafficking charge in Boston.
Mejia was arrested for allegedly selling fentanyl to an undercover officer; he faces up to 20 years in prison.
Mejia, previously a player for the Fredericksburg Nationals, is scheduled for a court hearing on December 1.

title: Education technology company to close Boston headquarters, embrace fully remote workplace
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Cengage Group will close its Boston, Detroit, and Cincinnati offices, opting for a fully remote workforce.
The education technology company has nearly 4,000 employees and serves 90 million students in 125 countries.
Cengage Group moved its headquarters from Stamford, Conn. to Boston in 2014 and now operates remotely.

title: What Patriots players did during their off day that impressed Mike Vrabel
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: 41 Patriots players worked out on their off day at Gillette Stadium, a move praised by coach Mike Vrabel.
Despite their 7-2 record, the Patriots focus on continued improvement, showing commitment with voluntary off-day workouts.
Stefon Diggs highlighted the importance of building team identity and effort beyond just their current record.

title: Officials identify two killed in apparent murder-suicide in Beverly
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Becky Lynn Center, 58, and John Patrick Nesbitt, 56, were found dead in Beverly on Colonial Drive, Monday night.
Both victims were pronounced dead at the scene with gunshot wounds in what officials consider an apparent murder-suicide.
The incident is under investigation by Beverly police, Massachusetts State Police, and the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner.

title: South Boston man linked to Bulger sentenced to 15 years for involvement in 1984, 1993 cold case killings
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Michael Lewis, linked to James "Whitey" Bulger, was sentenced to 15 years for 1984 and 1993 manslaughter cases.
Lewis pleaded guilty to manslaughter, resolving first-degree murder charges for the deaths of Brian Watson and William Villani.
Prosecutors linked Lewis to Watson’s death through a 2009 federal case break, resolving the New Hampshire cold case.

title: Olney: Red Sox ‘well-positioned’ to try and trade for Tigers ace Tarik Skubal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox are reportedly interested in trading for Tigers pitcher Tarik Skubal, according to ESPN's Buster Olney.
Skubal, the reigning AL Cy Young winner, led the league in ERA and WHIP in the last season with Detroit.
Boston has the resources and fiscal flexibility to potentially acquire and retain Skubal long-term.

title: Judge temporarily halts patron saint statues in Quincy, but PETA wants to help
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Judge temporarily halted installation of two 10-foot bronze patron saint statues in Quincy, citing their religious significance.
PETA offered to help fund the statues if Quincy adds a St. Francis of Assisi statue, promoting animal kindness.
ACLU filed a lawsuit against the city, with a judge granting an injunction and denying a motion to dismiss.

title: Bill Belichick commends Drake Maye for an ‘outstanding’ start with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick praised Patriots QB Drake Maye for his outstanding performance in the 2025 NFL season.
Maye has led the Patriots to a 7-2 record, completing 74.1% of passes with 2,285 yards and 17 touchdowns.
Maye is considered a strong MVP candidate, with DraftKings placing his odds behind Josh Allen and Patrick Mahomes.
